comments.raw_text:
It's certainly not a showstopper, but it doesn't seem entirely ideal that users are shown this message when they try to view a webm attachment;

"Attachment is not viewable in your browser because its MIME type (video/webm) is not one that your browser is able to display."

I did try this with Firefox release channel (5) and Aurora channel (7), along with Opera 11.50 and Chromium 14, all of which got the same response. So I'm guessing that this is a blanket issue rather than a browser detection issue. After all, clicking the download button opens the video in the browser anyway.

Whether this actually needs any specific attention I don't know, but I personally found the message misleading. Perhaps all that is needed is a change to the message.

The message doesn't need to be changed. What we need is what is already written in bug 458376 comment 18: a way for the browser to tell us if it can display an attachment inline or not. This is not our job to guess what the abilities of the browser is (especially when you know that it can depend on external plugins to display some MIME type).
